newsitem.title: IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-EYE INJURY FORCES EALES OUT OF WALLABIES' TOUR.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-EYE INJURY FORCES EALES OUT OF WALLABIES' TOUR.

text.p: Australian captain John Eales will miss the remainder of the Wallaby tour of Europe after fracturing an eye socket in his side's 22-12 victory over Ireland on Saturday.
It was originally thought Eales had suffered a bruised cornea after a high tackle by Irish centre Mark McCall but further tests revealed the outstanding lock's injury was more serious.
"He will be out for six to eight weeks," said Wallaby spokesman Greg Thomas. "He will be staying with the tour but vice-captain Tim Horan will be leading the side against Wales next weekend."
Horan described the injury as "a huge blow" and admitted the Wallabies were struggling in the second-row department.

Garrick Morgan and John Wellborn have already been ruled out of the tour and Eales's test colleague Warwick Waugh will miss the final match of the Wallabies' Irish itinerary against Munster this week with a bruised shoulder.
